io.vertx.ext.auth

Class PubSecKeyOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.vertx.ext.auth.PubSecKeyOptions

  • public class PubSecKeyOptions
extends Object
    Options describing Key stored in PEM format.
    Author:
    Paulo Lopes

      PubSecKeyOptions setId(String id) 
      PubSecKeyOptions setPublicKey(String publicKey)
      Deprecated. 
      This setter ignored the PEM prefix and suffix which would assume the key to be RSA. Use setBuffer(String) with the full content of your OpenSSL pem file. A PEM file must contain at least 3 lines: 
         -----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY----
   ...
   -----END PUBLIC KEY---
      PubSecKeyOptions setSecretKey(String secretKey)
      Deprecated. 
      This setter ignored the PEM prefix and suffix which would assume the key to be RSA. Use setBuffer(String) with the full content of your OpenSSL pem file. A PEM file must contain at least 3 lines: 
         -----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY----
   ...
   -----END PRIVATE KEY---

      • getAlgorithm

      • setAlgorithm

      • getBuffer

        public Buffer getBuffer()
        The PEM or Secret key buffer. When working with secret materials, the material is expected to be encoded in UTF-8. PEM files are expected to be US_ASCII as the format uses a base64 encoding for the payload.
        Returns:
        the buffer.

      • setBuffer

        public PubSecKeyOptions setBuffer(String buffer)
        The PEM or Secret key buffer. When working with secret materials, the material is expected to be encoded in UTF-8. PEM files are expected to be US_ASCII as the format uses a base64 encoding for the payload.
        Returns:
        self.

      • getPublicKey

        @Deprecated
public String getPublicKey()
        Deprecated. 

      • setPublicKey

        @Deprecated
public PubSecKeyOptions setPublicKey(String publicKey)
        Deprecated. This setter ignored the PEM prefix and suffix which would assume the key to be RSA. Use setBuffer(String) with the full content of your OpenSSL pem file. A PEM file must contain at least 3 lines: 
           -----BEGIN PUBLIC KEY----
   ...
   -----END PUBLIC KEY---
        Parameters:
        publicKey - the naked public key
        Returns:
        self

      • getSecretKey

        @Deprecated
public String getSecretKey()
        Deprecated. 

      • setSecretKey

        @Deprecated
public PubSecKeyOptions setSecretKey(String secretKey)
        Deprecated. This setter ignored the PEM prefix and suffix which would assume the key to be RSA. Use setBuffer(String) with the full content of your OpenSSL pem file. A PEM file must contain at least 3 lines: 
           -----BEGIN PRIVATE KEY----
   ...
   -----END PRIVATE KEY---
        Parameters:
        secretKey - the naked public key
        Returns:
        self
